channel.title: Client Crashing due to JDK?
channel.description:
[code]# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d84a566, pid=3520, t id=4564 # # JRE version: 6.0_18-b07 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (16.0-b13 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x5a566] # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # H:\RS\Clients\MoparScape\hs_err_pid3520.log # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp # Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Really need some help here,Do i have to download a older version of JDK if so which one? Is there any files I can edit to fix this problem?
Thanks!
Code god of RS
EDIT: It crashes once I walk,After a couple of frames! If I stay still I'm fine! (My Character)

item.title: Client Crashing due to JDK?

@george.mikal wrote:

thanks m.dog311 for sharing link here…usefull that was…i have read

item.title: Client Crashing due to JDK?
item.dc:creator: @z21 z2
item.description:
@z21 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:3, topic:330128”]You’re on a 64 bit computer, and have a 32 bit version of java installed, or you have a 32 bit computer, and you’re running a 64 bit java.
Read this.

An error report file with more information is saved as:

H:\RS\Clients\MoparScape\hs_err_pid3520.log

Try looking in there and posting here also

It’s going to give him exactly what he just posted, with extra things that are useless to him, and don’t really help us much either.[/quote]
It might be hes trying to run a 64 bit version of java on his 32 bit computer because a lot of 32 bit programs will run on 64 bit machines. (excluding majority of anti-virus’s, and some hardware installations)

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crashing due to JDK?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

You’re on a 64 bit computer, and have a 32 bit version of java installed, or you have a 32 bit computer, and you’re running a 64 bit java.
Read this.

[quote=“z2, post:2, topic:330128”]# An error report file with more information is saved as:

H:\RS\Clients\MoparScape\hs_err_pid3520.log

Try looking in there and posting here also[/quote]
It’s going to give him exactly what he just posted, with extra things that are useless to him, and don’t really help us much either.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crashing due to JDK?

item.description:
@code_god_of_rs wrote:

[code]#

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d84a566, pid=3520, t

id=4564

JRE version: 6.0_18-b07

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (16.0-b13 mixed mode windows-amd64

)

Problematic frame:

V [jvm.dll+0x5a566]

An error report file with more information is saved as:

H:\RS\Clients\MoparScape\hs_err_pid3520.log

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Really need some help here,Do i have to download a older version of JDK if so which one?
Is there any files I can edit to fix this problem?

Thanks!

Code god of RS

EDIT:
It crashes once I walk,After a couple of frames! If I stay still I’m fine!
